record.titleName: Research Institutes, Laboratory for Astrophysics and Space Research

record.creatorPhotographer: Publications Branch Laboratories for Applied Science
record.description: [Built at the Laboratory for Astrophysics and Space Research of the Enrico Fermi Institute at the University of Chicago, the Explorer VI satellite was launched August 7, 1959 and circled Earth taking photographs.]
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: PR and photographer stamp. Torn corner. Red pen marks along the sides.
